  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 19th a leaking package was found during the PM sort. The package contained four one gallon cans that are classified as UN1263, PAINT, 3, III. One of the cans positive closure failed allowing the contents to leak out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024091476
item.description:
Report X-2024091476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=778393819080 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1950 CLASS=21 QTY UOM=Gas - Milliliter PSN TEXT=Aerosols, flammable PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=500 CONTAINER UOM=Gas - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=400 TOTAL UOM=Gas - Milliliter )Two fiberboard boxes of a nineteen pieces shipment showed signs of a release at the MEMH location. Each box contained one Hazmat pad for padding. One of the fiberboard boxes had four large clear Ziploc bags filled with fifty tiny bottles per bag. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. The 2nd box contained twelve spray cans, eleven smaller spray cans, and one large clear Ziploc bag filled with fifty tiny bottles. Four bottles in one bag leaked their contacts from the top caps of the bottles. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024091442
item.description:
Report X-2024091442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sept 14th a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package was marked and labeled as UN1263, Petroleum Distillates N.O.S., 3, III. INside the package 2 of the cans leaked due to not being properly prepared for shipment. There were no ring locks or any secondary containment. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024090446
item.description:
Report E-2024090446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 23:00 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NNA. It was reported that approximately 137.5 gallons of UN3266 Natural HDPE FCL13 released from a plastic tote due to a pole on another piece of freight puncturing the tote during the unloading process. The release impacted inside of trailer #3153521 and asphalt. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 180-gallons of product released to a 300-yard x 400-yard are of the asphalt lot as well as the trailer floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized. All impacted absorbents and the cut up poly tote were then containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091113
item.description:
Report X-2024091113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/12/2024 at approximately 2315, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 2 metal cans of paint packaged in one fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered displaying stains, prompting further investigation, which resulted in confirmation of spillage. One of the can showed evidence of paint spilling inside of the plastic closure. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and is being held, awaitng an amended Shipper' s Declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2024091061
item.description:
Report X-2024091061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic bucket was dropped during the unloading process. The bucket received a crack on the bottom causing the contents to spill out. The bucket and all materials used for clean up were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024091062
item.description:
Report X-2024091062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a metal drum was dropped during the loading process. The drum received a dent on both the bottom and top chime the damage to the top chime resulted in a release of the contents. The metal drum was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024090312
item.description:
Report X-2024090312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A return, Generator with gas still in tank, was sent through the system in an unmarked U-Haul box. Package was placed on van line and went overhead. Damage occurred by simulator at Load-side 135. The package showed no external indications of gasoline, including smell, prior to spill. An employee handling the package after the spill, accidently rubbed their eye. The eye wash station was used before leaving for the emergency room. Chemical spill occurred inside trailer as well, number of packages affected unknown. Neutralizer used on the spill.

item.description:
Report X-2024091060

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The outer box is marked as "Overpack" with 4 plastic bottles inside. The bottles were wrapped in bubble wrap. There was no inner box, not a true overpack. The package was placed in a salvage drum and held pending dispostion from the shipper.
